info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:53AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 252 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles north of Lee Creek, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations in or near the path include... Lee Creek... Devils Den State Park... Blackburn... Odell... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 37 and 41, and near mile marker 43. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
